Fernando Research Group

From Processing to Performance: Understanding Organic Electronic Materials

  • Home
  • About

  • Contact

The Fernando Research Group explores sustainable organic electronic material systems, with a focus on understanding how processing conditions impact local structure and electronic function.

Department of Physics & Astronomy, Union College

Research Directions

Nanoscale Characterization

We use advanced characterization techniques to study local charge transport and morphological variation at the nanoscale in organic electronic materials.

Key Techniques:
  • Conductive Atomic Force Microscopy (c-AFM)
  • Scanning Probe Microscopy (SPM)
  • Electrical property mapping
Recent Work:
  • Y6 Electrical Connectivity – ACS Applied Energy Materials (2023)

Processing & Structure Control

We investigate how solution processing conditions influence film morphology and electronic performance in organic photovoltaics and semitransparent electrodes.

Research Focus:
  • Solution processing optimization
  • GIWAXS structural characterization
  • Thin-film fabrication and control
Recent Work:
  • Lyotropic Liquid Crystal Assembly – Advanced Materials (2025)

Sustainable Electronics

We develop environmentally conscious strategies for processing organic electronic materials, focusing on green solvents and sustainable fabrication methods.

Research Focus:
  • Green solvent processing
  • PEDOT:PSS sustainable formulation
  • Environmentally friendly fabrication
Recent Work:
  • Green Solvent Processing – Chemistry of Materials (2024)

Recent News

January 2025 Dr. Fernando joins Union College as Assistant Professor of Physics & Astronomy
December 2024 New paper on lyotropic liquid crystal mediated polymer assembly published in Advanced Materials
March 2024 Research on green solvent processing featured in Chemistry of Materials
